name: Many Equal Substrings
description:
You are given a string 
    t
 consisting of 
    n
 lowercase Latin letters
and an integer number 
    k
. Let's define a substring of some string 
    s

with indices from 
    l
 to 
    r
 as 
    s[l 
    … r]
. Your task is to
construct such string 
    s
 of minimum possible length that there are
exactly 
    k
 positions 
    i
 such that 
    s[i 
    … i + n - 1] = t
.
In other words, your task is to construct such string 
    s
 of minimum
possible length that there are exactly 
    k
 substrings of 
    s
 equal to

    t
. It is guaranteed that the answer is always unique. Input The first
line of the input contains two integers 
    n
 and 
    k
 (
    1 
    ≤ n, k
    
    ≤ 50
) — the length of the string 
    t
 and the number of substrings.
The second line of the input contains the string 
    t
 consisting of exactly

    n
 lowercase Latin letters. Output Print such string 
    s
 of minimum
possible length that there are exactly 
    k
 substrings of 
    s
 equal to

    t
. It is guaranteed that the answer is always unique. Examples Input 3 4
aba Output ababababa Input 3 2 cat Output catcat
